definition[0]: a narrow area of land that separates the two sides of a big road in order to keep traffic travelling in different directions apart
definition[1]: the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order
definition[2]: a line passing from one of the points of a triangle to the centre of the opposite side
definition[3]: being the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order
example[0]: The median age of the group is 42.
definition[4]: in or passing through the middle of something
definition[5]: the median number is the middle one in a series of numbers, arranged in order
example[1]: The median sales price fell 1.4% from October.
example[2]: Median household income fell by 1.9% last year.
